result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.

11:22 AM Defendant Michael D Sellers in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Michael D Sellers.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests an adjournment of plea/sentencing hearing, to re-negotiate 1 part of offer with the State. State does not object. 
Court will set.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.

9:55 AM Defendant Michael D Sellers in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Michael D Sellers. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 

Defense requests a plea/sentencing. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:59 AM Defendant Michael D Sellers in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Michael D Sellers.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Cassandra Miller
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:09 PM Defendant Michael D Sellers in court with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

ADDRESS INFO for Michael D Sellers
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-29-2022)
Prior: 3121 N 37th St, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

COURT ORDERED A $300.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND (previously signed and reinstated).
If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Embassy Suites Hotel/Officers (with the exception of an emergency)/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:07 PM Defendant Michael D Sellers in court.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Defendant presents statements as to his non appearance at the prior court date.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defendant gives his bail recommendation.
The Court quashes the warrant.
The Defendant taken into custody at this time as he was not able to post his bail.
The Court will put the matter over for status of counsel on the next available calendar.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Code #2

02:43 PM Defendant Michael D Sellers not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing on June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Embassy Suites Hotel/Officers (with the exception of an emergency)/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:33 PM Defendant Michael D Sellers in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern Patrick Sicula.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
